page.title: 20Changes in Catbrook
page.content: There have been a number of changes in lifestyles in recent years. There is only one shop in the village now, whereas there used to be 3 shops - l butcher,l grocer and l sweets and Post Office. The shop in Whhitelye is no longer there. Housing has changed too - the Chapel House in Catbrook and the Chapel at Parkhouse used to be chapels, but have been converted into private homes. "Bovis Homes" have built on what was farming land. People need private transport as there are no longer 3 buses, but only one market bus on a Friday to Monmouth. The Youth Club has closed and the churches and chapels which used to have a full congregation are now usually attended by only a few people.The school is smaller now and will close in l987 when children will attend the new school in Trellech.
